alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Bexar; Blanco; Burnet; Caldwell; Comal; Gillespie; Guadalupe; Hays; Kendall; Llano; Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 06 at 2:23AM CDT until August 06 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Increased Fire Danger Continues Across South Central Texas... .A combination of critically to extremely dry fuels and elevated fire weather conditions continue to support wildfires with high resistance to control, per guidance from the Texas A&M Forest Service. It is also being observed that in this very hot air mass relatively light prevailing winds are routinely gusting to more than double the value of the sustained speeds, reaching between 20 and 25 MPH in the late afternoon and early evening hours. Based on these observed conditions and impacts, a Red Flag Warning will be in effect for the eastern Hill Country and much of the I-35 corridor Sunday afternoon and evening, with additional Red Flag Warnings likely beyond Sunday. Elevated to near critical fire weather conditions are expected for the remainder of South Central Texas. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE EASTERN HILL COUNTRY AND ADJACENT AREAS OF THE I-35 CORRIDOR... * WINDS...South 10 to 15 mph with gusts to around 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...20 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly and exhibit high resistance to control. Any outdoor activity that could produce flames or sparks is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
